author: Special Correspondent
text:
Visitors taking a look at the videos screened during the voter awareness programme at the Tirunelveli Collectorate.— Photo: M. Lakshmi Arun

Collector M. Karunakaran inaugurated the voter awareness video shows and photo exhibition on the Collectorate premises on Thursday.

As the Election Commission of India intends to achieve cent per cent voter turnout during the forthcoming Assembly polls, Dr. Karunakaran inaugurated the voter awareness video shows to be screened in colleges, bus stands, villages across the district and also in places of public congregation. Moreover, voter awareness photo exhibition, pasting of posters, issuing of pamphlets, skits and cultural programmes would be conducted in these places.

“Each Returning Officer has been entrusted with the task of conducting voter awareness programmes in these intended places to reach the electorate in an effective fashion,” the Collector said. He made it clear that only unaccounted cash above Rs. 50,000 would be seized and informed that the ex-servicemen had been urged to participate in the election-related security arrangements to be made in all Assembly segments. District Revenue Officer M.G. Kulandaivel was present.
title: Video shows, photo expo to raise voter awareness
